howhear: I first learned about NixCon last year and was excited to learn that there was one taking place in North America.
whyattend: Interested in learning more about Nix and joining the community.
futuretopics: I thought the workshops on day one were fantastic, incl encouraging existing community members to help others.
eventlikemost: The overviews were helpful as a beginner. And karaoke!
bigtakeaway: I have a fairly narrow understanding of Nix going into the event, and I thought the event did a good job featuring the range of efforts across the ecosystem. My biggest takeaway was that there's a wide variety of ways to engage with the project and to get involved.

whyattend: To meet other Nix users and help make Nix awesome!

howhear: I saw it come up on the forum and started following it from there.
whyattend:
A chance to meet up with other Nix nerds and talk about Nix? Count me in. 

Most of the talks were intro, but even those usually had a small nugget I'd never seen or heard of. It was great!
usenixwork[other]: Only on my work machine, not on servers
mostvaluablesession:
I hugely enjoyed Xe's talk about Docker images, as well as Matthew's talk Nix the Planet (which wasn't technically NixCon, but was Nix-oriented)
The self-hosting modules one was also interesting, as I've only written a few modules for myself thus far.
futuretopics:
Secret handling (which isn't special to nix, but does have interesting implications wrt the nix store and keeping them encrypted there, i.e. sops or agenix)
Maybe something a bit deeper on derivations?
I think a talk that goes through NixOS setup could be interesting, potentially with flakes. One of the "click" moments for me was being able to just casually switch DE to try them out when I first started.
eventlikemost: Getting to talk to a bunch of other Nix enthusiasts (and experts) was a phenomenal experience. It's always so interesting to see the different ways people use Nix.
eventlikeleast: Probably just the room setup, which might not even be a problem with the con itself. The projector on the wall (first day) was hard to see, especially with the lighting. The second day was marginally better on the screen, at the cost of being a bit smaller.
eventimprovefuture: I can't think of anything off the top of my head, overall it seemed to go pretty well. I saw a few requests for assistance in the Matrix, but it seemed to always get covered.
bigtakeaway:
Nix has a much larger user-base than I would have expected. Of course it's bigger than any given event, but the amount of people who came *specifically* for NixCon was a big surprise. 
I'm glad to see such an active community.

whyattend: To meet fellow nixos users.
To meet fellow nix users and learn latest development on nix.
mostvaluablesession: Building Robots with Nix and Bazel
futuretopics: Nix internals

eventlikeleast: The depth of the content
eventimprovefuture: Have a separate advanced track

whyattend: Nix/NixOS are amazing.  Want to learn more and meet other like-minded invididuals.
usenixwork[other]: in testing, but nowhere in production (yet)
enoughtimediscussion[comment]: The talks were definitely squished together, with a tiny amount of time between.  Lunch was only an hour, and the exhibit hall was only open during time when I wanted to be attending talks or syncing with folks in the common area.  The only time there was enough time for discussion was the unconf at the end of day 2.
mostvaluablesession: I can't choose just 1.  I got several things out of about half of the talks.  The beginner talk was great, not for me, but as a video I can refer others to in the future.  It really needed to be split up into at least 2 talks as there was so much more for him to say.
futuretopics: I would like to see more intermediate (selfish reason!!!).  The talk on NixOS module dev was great, but still too basic.
eventlikemost: The networking.  I met so many great people.
eventlikeleast: Technical difficulties are always a possibility.  We had network issues, external rate limiting, projector issues, the sound quality wasn't too great for those of us that are hard of hearing.  On day 1 the screen was so small compared to the room size that even with 20/10 vision I could barely see from about half way down.
eventimprovefuture: See above "like least about the event"
bigtakeaway: I have a lot to learn, and that Nix is growing like crazy.  I'm happy to be along for the ride.

whyattend:
- To meet people the other cool people who use Nix and who probably have more Nix experience than I do
- To learn new things about Nix
- To potentially help others with Nix
- To solve some Nix problems of mine
- To become more connected to the Nix community
enoughtimediscussion[comment]: Generally i felt like I had enough time outside of talks to ask questions that I had and to meet new Nix folk. I certainly wouldn't aim for less, and I think more could be good so long as people don't get bored and leave. I think having semi-structured ways to foster discussion might be valuable additions to the conference.
mostvaluablesession: Hard to answer! I listened to most the talks and took some different value away from each one. As an experienced Nix user, I think I probably got the most out of the substituters and remote builders presentation, though I definitely don't remember everything I need from it. I also really valued the state of the union talk.
futuretopics: My answers today probably (hopefully) won't be reflective of what I would say approx. a year from now, but current me would love to hear some insight from the docs team (e.g., how new users can contribute, what they're up to, etc.), some workshop-style material on how to do secrets management, some in-depth packaging tutorials (for nixpkgs or personal use).
eventlikemost: Opportunities to connect with awesome people in the Nix community. And the NixCon NA 2024 website that made it super easy to plan for attending the conference.
eventlikeleast: The SCaLE Wi-Fi.
eventimprovefuture: Please continue to co-locate with SCaLE unless there is somehow some other more compelling option. As for actual improvements, none come to mind. It was awesome!
bigtakeaway: I need more Nix events in my life.

whyattend: To support/help David and Dan where I could, get more general knowledge about Nix and its applications(which according to Matthew is probably limitless), and network

eventlikeleast: I think in general, a Thursday-Friday event is tough. There were some people who came later in the evening expressing interest in Nix but unable to attend due to work.
eventimprovefuture: Perhaps a dedicated information booth for how to get more involved with the community could be beneficial. I think that could provide a good bridge between people who are new/are not involved with the community and those who are. howhear: A coworker who is a big Nix fan
whyattend: I'm using NixOS on my desktop to force myself to learn it, and use it a bit at work but would like to use it more.

howhear: I was invited by Zach and others.
whyattend: I am very interested in networking with the Nix community and building a deeper understanding of its future and market fit.
mostvaluablesession: I found the workshopping happening out in the made area the most impressive, and it seemed quite valuable. The meme was people were debating packaging at Ubucon, while folks were getting work done at NixCon.
futuretopics: Onboarding tracks are always great, maybe a local cache to reduce load on GitHub.
eventlikemost: Casual yet productive vibe.
eventlikeleast: Not much...
eventimprovefuture: Very selfish of me - but I'd love to see some structure around media. IE, someone who could work with media to identify folks that would make for good interviews, perhaps facilitate a small space to conduct those interviews. Because becoming in, we don't always know who is who, and who might be the unquie person from the community that made it to the event, who might be a big contributor, etc.
bigtakeaway:
I was impressed with the companies building around Nix. Equally, it feels like the market has only recently woken up to its value. While Nix itself has been around for a long time, the market fit is new. 

So, seeing faces from the foundation and these companies around Nix was very reassuring. It felt like intelligent people were on the job.

whyattend: I love Nix and I was invited to speak at SCALE

howhear: A combination of the nix discourse forum and NY nix users meet up events.
whyattend:
I use NixOS as the operating system for my personal computer. I also use it to build and package personal, public, and (more rarely but not never) professional software projects.

I'm really excited about the nix ecosystem of projects and I attended NixCon because I wanted to engage with the community, learn more about nix, and start to figure out how I can best contribute.
usenixwork[other]: Technically yes, but rarely. There's no effort to adopt nix at my organization and I the number of users I am aware of is very small.
enoughtimediscussion[comment]: I don't have an opinion on this.
mostvaluablesession: Probably the Nix State of the Union. It's really interesting to understand the organizational and community dynamics around nix, which are just as important to making the nix project work as the underlying research and technical implementation of the tools is.
futuretopics: I would love to see topics that serve as an introduction of a project to potential new contributors. I'm interested in contributing. Talks that explore the internals of an ecosystem tool, but in way that js approachable and friendly to intermediate users who are unfamiliar with the given tool's codebase, would be really helpful to me personally and also, I think, to the longevity of these tools and the broader community.
eventlikemost: The karaoke. Whose idea was this??? Also damn some people were really good?
eventlikeleast:
The unconference was cool, though I wish there would have been more opportunities that prompt conversations between strangers -- but it's also easy to overly cultivate that. The center area with tables was a good space for that. I guess I can't think of something I liked least...

Honestly, although I loved colocating the event with SCaLE, the location was kind of hard to get to if you weren't in the area and didn't have a car. LA traffic sucks, and going to the airport Sunday I almost missed my flight because of bizarrely timed road work. Maybe you all can fix that for next time? :)
eventimprovefuture: Force more people to sing karaoke.
bigtakeaway: The people behind nix are as cool as the technology.

whyattend: Community!
mostvaluablesession: I liked the state of the union, the Google experience report, and the unconference - not necessarily in that order.
futuretopics: I'd like to see more real world experience reports.
eventlikemost: I loved seeing my friends and community members and chatting with them.
eventlikeleast: I thought some of the talks were a little outside of my interests. A bit too basic I thought.
eventimprovefuture: More speakers! More attendees!
bigtakeaway: What a lovely conference! It was great to catch up with everyone!
